item.title: [DERBY-5133] nightly test failure in derbyall/storeall/storemore/SpaceTable
item.description:
http://dbtg.foundry.sun.com/derby/test/Daily/jvm1.4/testing/testlog/lin/1081468-derbyall_diff.txt

Failure Details:

                  • Diff file derbyall/storeall/storemore/SpaceTable.diff
      • Start: SpaceTable jdk1.4.2_02 storeall:storemore 2011-03-15 11:50:03 ***
        145 del
        < PLATYPUS |0 |1 |20 |4096 |81920
        145a145
        > PLATYPUS |0 |2 |19 |4096 |77824
        Test Failed.
      • End: SpaceTable jdk1.4.2_02 storeall:storemore 2011-03-15 11:50:13 ***
        ------------------------------------------------------

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: slightly different diff, but probably the same issue.

I saw a failure in this test, on 2/14, during a shadow-nightly run (so no results posted), with ibm 1.7 on windows, with trunk (10.9 alpha) updated to revision 1244317; same lines, with the following diff:
145 del
< PLATYPUS |0 |1 |20 |4096 |81920
145a145
> PLATYPUS |0 |3 |18 |4096 |73728

This happened again - trunk updated to revision 1312067 - with ibm 1.6, on the same machine (Windows XP) as the report of 2/14: http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/main/windows/testlog/ibm16/1312067-derbyall_diff.txt

marking urgency normal.
Note, that there is a call to CALL_FOR_POST_COMMIT following the delete.
Perhaps there is a problem with the routine org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.util.T_Access.waitForPostCommitToFinish.

Happened this time on 10.9.2.2 - (1538132) with ibm15 on Windows machine.
http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/v10_9/windows/testlog/ibm15/1538132-derbyall_diff.txt
Diff file derbyall/storeall/storemore/SpaceTable.diff
Start: SpaceTable jdk1.5.0 storeall:storemore 2013-11-01 20:49:07 ***
73 del
< IDELETEU |0 |1 |5 |4096 |20480
73a73
> IDELETEU |0 |2 |4 |4096 |16384
Test Failed.
End: SpaceTable jdk1.5.0 storeall:storemore 2013-11-01 20:49:19 ***
------------------------------------------------------
With trunk (10.11 alpha) SpaceTable.sql is part of StoreScriptsTest. I ran the entire StoreScriptsTest suite 100x with (ibm 1.7) but the test did not fail.

I double checked saved records, and the last time this failed on any branch 10.8 and higher was Nov last year, on 10.8 branch at revision 1542453, with ibm 1.5:
http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/v10_8/windows/testSummary-1542453.html

I'm attaching a patch which converts the SpaceTable.sql to junit and has a simplified local version of the JDBC.AssertFullResultSet which gets called in the two unstable situations, and when it sees a difference, it will do the select from the space_table again. If it is still different in the second comparison, it throws the assert.

The store _Suite ran clean with this. I'll leave this until tomorrow before committing, in case anyone wants/has time to review this approach.

The tearDown() method looks a bit odd. For example, this line contains a syntax error (should have used double quotes instead of single quotes):

        stmt.executeUpdate("drop table 'platypus2'");

The tearDown() method seems to give up dropping tables the first time it finds one of the tables doesn't exist. Since the different test cases create different sets of tables, I think there needs to be a try/catch block around each single DROP TABLE statement, not one big try/catch block around all of them as there currently is. Otherwise, it won't drop all tables as intended (and I'm assuming that's also why the syntax error mentioned above wasn't detected). Using the helper method dropTable() in BaseJDBCTestCase would give you this for free.

The comment for checkSpaceTable() says it will sleep a bit before retrying, but I can't see that it actually sleeps. Is it missing a call to BaseTestCase.sleep()?

Instead of duplicating JDBC.assertFullResultSet(), would it be possible to base assertSpaceTableOK() on just calling JDBC.assertFullResultSet()? Something along the lines of:

    try {
        JDBC.assertFullResultSet(rs, expRS);
    } catch (AssertionFailedError e) {
        if (trytwice) {
            sleep(x);
            assertSpaceTableOK(tableName, expRS, false);
        } else {
            throw e;
        }
    }

Commit 1594231 from Myrna van Lunteren in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1594231 ]

DERBY-5133; nightly test failure in derbyall/storeall/storemore/SpaceTable
converting the test to junit, with a retry for the selects that have shown instability

Commit 1594293 from Myrna van Lunteren in branch 'code/branches/10.10'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1594293 ]

DERBY-5133; nightly test failure in derbyall/storeall/storemore/SpaceTable
converting the test to junit, with a retry for the selects that have shown instability
merge of revision 1594231 from trunk

Thanks Knut Anders for the review - I didn't see it before committing.
I will change the test to use the JDBCTestCase.dropTable() and look at the retry method.
I changed my mind about doing the sleep and decided to first see if the test will fail with just the retry - a sleep can always be added later if the test fails again, but I forgot to modify the comment.

Commit 1594451 from Myrna van Lunteren in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1594451 ]

DERBY-5133; nightly test failure in derbyall/storeall/storemore/SpaceTable
addressing review input; using JDBCTestCase.dropTable(), simplifying the retry and eliminating the code duplication, and adjusting comments.
Also addresses failure with Java8 because of different test case sequence.

Commit 1594456 from Myrna van Lunteren in branch 'code/branches/10.10'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1594456 ]

DERBY-5133; nightly test failure in derbyall/storeall/storemore/SpaceTable
merge of revision 1594451 from trunk
addressing review input; using JDBCTestCase.dropTable(), simplifying the retry and eliminating the code duplication, and adjusting comments.
Also addresses failure with Java8 because of different test case sequence.

Commit 1594754 from Myrna van Lunteren in branch 'code/branches/10.9'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1594754 ]

DERBY-5133; nightly test failure in derbyall/storeall/storemore/SpaceTable
backport of revision 1594231 and revision 1594451 from trunk
converting the test to junit and calling a retry of the problematic selects.

Commit 1595075 from Myrna van Lunteren in branch 'code/branches/10.8'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1595075 ]

DERBY-5133; nightly test failure in derbyall/storeall/storemore/SpaceTable
merge of revision 1594754 from 10.9, which was a backport of revision 1594231 and revision 1594451 from trunk
converting the test to junit and calling a retry of the problematic selects
closing. If this fails again in the same spots (i.e. after the deletes), the next thing to try is to add a sleep before retrying the assert.
bulk change to close all issues resolved but not closed and not changed since June 1, 2014.
